alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 9:32PM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.1 feet Tuesday morning and will rise above flood stage Wednesday afternoon. The river is forecast to crest at 20.4 feet early Thursday morning and will then begin falling. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 01/20/1988. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
